ygData.subject: Re: [cantera] Will Mixmaster be updated in new release?
ygData.msgSnippet: Martin, I m glad Mixmaster is useful to you.  I ll take a look at the problems you mentioned. Dave

Martin,

I'm glad Mixmaster is useful to you.  I'll take a look at the problems  
you mentioned.

Dave


On Tuesday, August 5, 2003, at 02:40 AM, msrasmus wrote:

> Hi Dave
>
> I have used chemkin for several years, but are slowly trying to change  
> my platform
> to cantera, and am indeed impressed with the work you have done.
>
> I like using Mixmaster for visualization of my simulation data, since  
> it includes a nice
> overview of species and reaction data. Nevertheless, if I use large  
> mechanisms I
> can only see the first 20-40 reactions depending on my screen  
> resolution. Would it
> be possible to include a scroll function in this window in a future  
> release of
> Mixmaster?
>
> Furthermore, I have a Cantera_work directory on my linux box, where I  
> keep all
> files from my simulations, but when I use Mixmaster, the program tend  
> to dump all
> the files it creates during a run in the root of my home directory.  
> Would it be
> possible to make Mixmaster dump it's files in the directory where a  
> data file is
> loaded from in a future release of Mixmaster?
>
> Finally, just a minor detail. In the Help -> About Cantera... there is  
> no pop-up
> window. When I run Mixmaster on a windows XP machine I get several  
> error
> messages when I press the About Cantera..., and on one occasion it  
> crashed
> python.
>
> That's all
>
> Best Regards
> Martin
>
